content:
# The attempt to craft an Iron Chest has failed because I do not have enough iron plates in my inventory. 
# My inventory currently shows: 
# - 10 Coal
# - 10 Stone
# - 1 Iron Plate

# To proceed, I need to smelt more iron ore into iron plates. 
# Since I have 9 iron ore left in the furnace, I will first check the furnace's inventory to confirm this.

furnace_inventory = inspect_inventory(furnace)  # Check the inventory of the furnace
print(f"Furnace inventory: {furnace_inventory}")

# Since the furnace has iron ore, I will insert some coal into it to smelt the remaining iron ore into plates.
insert_item(Prototype.Coal, furnace, quantity=5)  # Insert 5 coal into the furnace for smelting

# Reinsert the remaining iron ore to allow the furnace to smelt it into iron plates.
insert_item(Prototype.IronOre, furnace, quantity=9)  # Insert the remaining 9 iron ore

# Wait for the smelting process to finish and check the inventory again.
for _ in range(30):  # Maximum 30 seconds wait
    if inspect_inventory(furnace)[Prototype.IronPlate] >= 9:  # Expecting at least 9 more iron plates to be produced
        break
    sleep(1)
else:
    raise Exception("Smelting timeout - check fuel and inputs again.")

# Verify the inventory to see results after smelting.
print(f"Inventory after smelting: {inspect_inventory()}")
print(f"Entities on the map: {get_entities()}")
